DOC.brief_summary: To compare the effectiveness and safety of diuretics add-on strategy in chronic heart failure patients
DOC.brief_title: A Prospective, Single-center, Randomized, Controlled, Open-label, Pilot Study to Compare the Effectiveness and Safety of DIuretics Add-On Strategy in Acute Decompensated Heart Failure Patients (DIOS II)
DOC.criteria: 1. dyspnea at rest or minimal activity 2. tachypnea (respiratory rate > 20/min) or rales or pulmonary edema on chest Xray 1. hospitalization for acute heart failure decompensation 2. cardiogenic shock (Systolic Blood Pressure < 80mmHg) 3. Need or plan for renal replacement therapy (dialysis, kidney transplant) 4. serum creatine level > 2.5mg/dl 5. serum potassium (K+) > 5.5mg/dl 6. Age > 80 years old or poor compliance patients 7. allergy, adverse drug reaction, hypersensitivity to any kinds of diuretics 8. life expectancy < 6 months (e.g. metastatic malignancy, liver cirrhosis) 9. pregnancy or women at age of childbearing potential
DOC.keyword: Heart failure, diuretics, kidney, glomerular filtration rate
